intellimate.izou.output

Class OutputPlugin<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • intellimate.izou.output.OutputPlugin<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable, ExceptionCallback, java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class OutputPlugin<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, Identifiable, ExceptionCallback
    The OutputPlugin class gets Event and then starts threads filled with output-extension tasks to create the final output and then render it on its own medium

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OutputPlugin(java.lang.String id, Context context)
      creates a new output-plugin with a new id

      void run()
      main method for outputPlugin, runs the data-conversion and output-renderer when the outputExtensions are done processing the Event object, they add their finished objects into tDoneList, from where they will have to be gotten to render them in renderFinalOutput

        Returns:

      • distributeEvent

        public void distributeEvent(Event event)
        distributes the Event in the eventDataList to the output-extensions that will need them. all OutputExtensions have a wishList, where Ids of resources are stored. This method compares the wishList with resources in provided from the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the Event to distribute

      • addOutputExtension

        public void addOutputExtension(OutputExtension<T> outputExtension)
        add outputExtension to outputExtensionList
        Parameters:
        outputExtension - the output-extension to be added to outputExtensionList

      • removeOutputExtension

        public void removeOutputExtension(java.lang.String id)
        removes output-extensions from outputExtensionList removes output-extensions from outputExtensionList, outputExtensionList is an ArrayList that stores all outputExtensions of all OutputPlugins
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the output extension to be removed

      • getContext

        public Context getContext()
        returns the Context of the AddOn. Context provides some general Communications.
        Returns:
        an instance of Context.

      • outputExtensionWasAdded

        public void outputExtensionWasAdded(OutputExtension<T> outputExtension)

      • prepareDistribution

        public void prepareDistribution(OutputExtension<T> outputExtension)
        method that can be overwritten in order to "do stuff" before an outputExtension is started
        Parameters:
        outputExtension - the outputExtension which is about to be started

      • renderFinalOutput

        public abstract void renderFinalOutput()
        method that uses tDoneList to generate a final output that will then be rendered. The processed data is found in tDoneList

      • outputDataIsDone

        public void outputDataIsDone(java.util.concurrent.Future<T> tFuture)
        The event raised when an outputData has finished processing and is about to be added to the tDoneList. It is NOT raised immediately raised after it is done, instead it is raised exactly when it is about to be added to the tDoneList, by which time all other outputExtensions will also have finished. However it is an opportunity to work with a finished future object (or get the outputData inside) before it is thrown back into the heap.
        Parameters:
        tFuture - future object that contains the processed outputExtension data

      • blockingQueueHandling

        public Event blockingQueueHandling()
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Default implementation waits until a new Event has been received and then processes it. This method is made to be overwritten as seen fit by the developer
        Returns:
        the recently added Event-instance to be processed by the outputPlugin
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting

      • isDone

        public void isDone(Event event)
        Parameters:
        event - the current processed Event

      • exceptionThrown

        public void exceptionThrown(java.lang.Exception e)
        this method gets called when the task submitted to the ThreadPool crashes

      • timeOut

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.concurrent.Future<T>> timeOut(java.util.LinkedList<java.util.concurrent.Future<T>> futures)
        creates a 1 sec. timeout for the OutputExtension
        Parameters:
        futures - a List of futures running
        Returns:
        list with all elements removed, who aren't finished after 1 sec

      • run

        public void run()
        main method for outputPlugin, runs the data-conversion and output-renderer when the outputExtensions are done processing the Event object, they add their finished objects into tDoneList, from where they will have to be gotten to render them in renderFinalOutput
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
